articles.headline: With Detailed Evidence and a Call for Accountability, Jan. 6 Panel Seeks a Legacy
articles.snippet: The final report of the committee provides many new details on former President Donald J. Trump’s actions and a record for history. But Republicans will soon begin a campaign to discredit it.
articles.abstract: The final report of the committee provides many new details on former President Donald J. Trump’s actions and a record for history. But Republicans will soon begin a campaign to discredit it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House Jan. 6 committee’s 845-page final report is chock-full of new details about former President Donald J. Trump’s effort to overturn the 2020 election.

articles.headline: Britain’s Soaring Energy Costs Strain Crisis Responders
articles.snippet: Families in chilly, drafty homes are seeking help. The response may be a blanket and thick socks, while some doctors are writing prescriptions for heat.
articles.abstract: Families in chilly, drafty homes are seeking help. The response may be a blanket and thick socks, while some doctors are writing prescriptions for heat.
articles.lead_paragraph: The day after an arctic blast of air hit Britain, plunging temperatures below freezing and blanketing the country in frost, a 72-year-old man finally got through to the advice phone line of Warm and Well, a charitable service in Gloucestershire, in the west of England.

articles.headline: Jingle Bell Time Is a Swell Time to Decide About a 2024 Campaign
articles.snippet: A host of Democrats and Republicans say they’ll discuss running for office with their families, weighing their political futures with eggnog, board games and maybe a wise uncle.
articles.abstract: A host of Democrats and Republicans say they’ll discuss running for office with their families, weighing their political futures with eggnog, board games and maybe a wise uncle.
articles.lead_paragraph: For everything in politics, there is a season. A period of primaries to winnow the field. Party conventions in the summertime. The Labor Day kickoff of the general election.

articles.headline: When a Taylor Swift Concert Means Getting Your First Credit Card
articles.snippet: For some fans, a chance to see their favorite artists in concert is the most compelling reason to sign up for their first credit cards and start building credit.
articles.abstract: For some fans, a chance to see their favorite artists in concert is the most compelling reason to sign up for their first credit cards and start building credit.
articles.lead_paragraph: Halie Smith’s devotion to Taylor Swift runs so deep that she feels as if she can trust her like a friend. After the pop star encouraged fans to vote in the 2018 midterm elections, Ms. Smith registered. The 23-year-old’s most recent rite of passage — getting her first credit card — was also prompted by the singer.

articles.headline: Betting Apps Can Make Anyone a Sports Fan. Even Me.
articles.snippet: One in five Americans bet on sports this year. Against most odds — my total lack of interest in all professional athletics — I was one of them. And I was hooked.
articles.abstract: One in five Americans bet on sports this year. Against most odds — my total lack of interest in all professional athletics — I was one of them. And I was hooked.
articles.lead_paragraph: The flight attendant informed us there would be no Wi-Fi. She sounded cheery and calm. I was not. For the 3 hours 10 minutes it would take to reach Des Moines from New York, I would be unable to check the score in the Cleveland Guardians’ game against the San Diego Padres, or in the Washington Nationals’ game against the Seattle Mariners.

articles.headline: How the Worst Fears for Democracy Were Averted in 2022
articles.snippet: A precariously narrow but consequential slice of the electorate broke with its own voting history to reject openly extremist Republican candidates — at least partly out of concern for the health of the political system.
articles.abstract: A precariously narrow but consequential slice of the electorate broke with its own voting history to reject openly extremist Republican candidates — at least partly out of concern for the health of the political system.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not long ago, Joe Mohler would have seemed an unlikely person to help bury the political legacy of Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Charles Homans, Jazmine Ulloa and Blake Hounshell

articles.headline: Lonely, Single and Over 50? China Has a Game Show for That.
articles.snippet: Several popular television programs in the country are helping to encourage conversations about the social, romantic and sexual needs of older Chinese people.
articles.abstract: Several popular television programs in the country are helping to encourage conversations about the social, romantic and sexual needs of older Chinese people.
articles.lead_paragraph: The introductory music was thumping, the male dating show contestant had walked onstage, and now came the interview portion, where female guests asked questions. One of the women launched right in.
articles.byline: By Vivian Wang and Joy Dong

articles.headline: Putin Wants Fealty, and He’s Found It in Africa
articles.snippet: As Moscow wages war in Ukraine, its mercenaries have already established control in the Central African Republic — with scant Western reaction.
articles.abstract: As Moscow wages war in Ukraine, its mercenaries have already established control in the Central African Republic — with scant Western reaction.
articles.lead_paragraph: BANGUI, Central African Republic — In early March, as Russia’s invasion of Ukraine entered its third week, a Russian diplomat nearly 3,000 miles away in the Central African Republic paid an unusual visit to the head of this country’s top court. His message was blunt: The country’s pro-Kremlin president must remain in office, indefinitely.
articles.byline: By Roger Cohen and Mauricio Lima

articles.headline: As Applications Fall, Police Departments Lure Recruits With Bonuses and Attention
articles.snippet: Many police chiefs say staffing levels have not rebounded from a wave of resignations that started with the pandemic and the 2020 unrest.
articles.abstract: Many police chiefs say staffing levels have not rebounded from a wave of resignations that started with the pandemic and the 2020 unrest.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As American police departments seek to overcome an exodus of disgruntled officers and a sudden decline in applications, they are wooing recruits with some of the tactics a football coach might use to land a prized quarterback.

articles.headline: How Citizen Spies Foiled Putin’s Grand Plan for One Ukrainian City
articles.snippet: A partisan cell in Kherson spied on, undermined and even hunted down Russian soldiers. Now that Vladimir V. Putin’s forces are gone, people feel free to talk — and to brag a little.
articles.abstract: A partisan cell in Kherson spied on, undermined and even hunted down Russian soldiers. Now that Vladimir V. Putin’s forces are gone, people feel free to talk — and to brag a little.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a foggy morning a few months ago, Valentyn Dmytrovych Yermolenko, an aging Ukrainian fisherman with a bad back and horrible knees, puttered down a narrow channel off the Dnipro River, his inflatable dinghy cutting through the mist.

articles.headline: Germany’s Energy Crisis Is a Cue to Chop Wood and Stock Up
articles.snippet: The high cost of natural gas and electricity is prompting many to prepare for outages and shortages. For some, it’s been a way of life for years.
articles.abstract: The high cost of natural gas and electricity is prompting many to prepare for outages and shortages. For some, it’s been a way of life for years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tightly stacked cords of wood line the side of a couple’s home in southern Germany, while another family farther north has lined their basement with shelves stacked with pasta, rice, cooking oil and cans of chickpeas, lentils and tomatoes.
articles.byline: By Melissa Eddy and Valentin Goppel

articles.headline: In Memphis, the Phonics Movement Comes to High School
articles.snippet: Literacy lessons are embedded in every academic class. Even in biology.
articles.abstract: Literacy lessons are embedded in every academic class. Even in biology.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEMPHIS — For much of his life, Roderick, a high school junior, did not enjoy reading. As a boy, he trudged through picture books that his mother encouraged him to read. As a teenager, he has sometimes wrestled with complex texts at school.

articles.headline: Democrats, Feeling New Strength, Plan to Go on Offense on Voting Rights
articles.snippet: After retaining most of the governor’s offices they hold and capturing the legislatures in Michigan and Minnesota, Democrats are putting forward a long list of proposals to expand voting access.
articles.abstract: After retaining most of the governor’s offices they hold and capturing the legislatures in Michigan and Minnesota, Democrats are putting forward a long list of proposals to expand voting access.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — For the last two years, Democrats in battleground states have played defense against Republican efforts to curtail voting access and amplify doubts about the legitimacy of the nation’s elections.

articles.headline: With ‘Zero Covid,’ China Proved It’s Good at Control. Governance Is Harder.
articles.snippet: For a powerful government that has bragged about its command of the country, its absence at a moment of crisis has made the public question its credibility.
articles.abstract: For a powerful government that has bragged about its command of the country, its absence at a moment of crisis has made the public question its credibility.
articles.lead_paragraph: In its single-minded pursuit of the “zero Covid” strategy, the Chinese government was omnipresent and omnipotent, using its unlimited resources and unchecked power to control the nation. Having nearly exhausted its resources and the good will of the public, the government has now simply disappeared, just as many Chinese are getting very ill with the virus or dying from it.

articles.headline: The Last Holdouts
articles.snippet: What it’s like to wear masks for Covid when most others have long since moved on.
articles.abstract: What it’s like to wear masks for Covid when most others have long since moved on.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bitsy Cherry had been bracing for the question ever since most of the members of a board game group that had started meeting online during the pandemic began attending in-person meetings a few months ago.
